definition: rivers and mountains are easy to change, man's character much harder
pinyin: jiang1 shan1 yi4 gai3 bing3 xing4 nan2 yi2

definition: mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes
to make a report (to a superior)/to give/to endow/to receive/petition
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]
to move/to shift/to change/to alter/to remove
